summary: San Francisco-based Dropbox announced Tuesday that will stop asking employees to come into its offices and instead make remote work the standard practice.
headline: Dropbox is the latest San Francisco tech company to make remote work permanent
Meet Kareem Daniel, the head of Disney's new distribution unit
summary: Disney has promoted Kareem Daniel, the former president of consumer products, games and publishing. He will now oversee the new media and entertainment distribution group.
With less than a month until the election, and Democratic challenger Joe Biden opening up a wide lead, two market analysts lay out how to trade the politically sensitive health-care sector.
headline: How to trade health care stocks into the 2020 U.S. presidential election
Personal finance advice relies on shame; what if we tried empathy?
summary: Emma Pattee and Stefanie O’Connell Rodriguez, the cofounders of Statement, argue the personal finance industry needs a reset. It's time to move away from shaming clients and show them empathy instead.

Facebook said Tuesday it is launching a new global policy that bans ads that discourage people from getting vaccines. The company previously did have a policy against vaccine hoaxes that were publicly identified by global health organizations.
headline: Facebook says it will finally ban anti-vaccination ads

summary: "The problems we've had here — the number of cases, the number of deaths, the number of hospitalizations — was not inevitable,” Dr. Ezekiel Emanuel told CNBC on Tuesday.
headline: Data shows failed U.S. coronavirus safety measures cost lives, says ex-Obama health advisor
Astroscale, which fixes and extends the life of satellites in orbit, raises $51 million
summary: Satellite services and debris removal specialist Astroscale on Tuesday announced it closed a $51 million round of funding.
President Trump and Democrats disagree over the amount of stimulus needed in the next round of coronavirus aid for the country. Here are the major topics of debate.
headline: What's the holdup? Why you haven't gotten a second $1,200 stimulus check
Renewed Clashes in West Ethiopia Leave at Least 12 People Dead
summary: Twelve people died in renewed clashes in Ethiopia’s western region of Benishangul-Gumuz, the country’s human rights commission said.
Treasury yields slipped on Tuesday as traders digest the latest news surrounding a potential U.S. fiscal stimulus package along with muted inflation growth.
headline: Treasury yields fall as traders weigh U.S. coronavirus stimulus prospects
"You're so stressed you can't sleep at night": Parents and child-care providers are still struggling as the pandemic drags on
summary: Before the coronavirus pandemic hit in March, there were nearly 12 million children under the age of 5 enrolled in some type of child care nationwide. But the pandemic caused widespread closures and enrollment still has not fully rebounded.
One of Wall Street's favorite charitable organizations has raised several million dollars to support a fund that invests in nonprofit groups run by people of color.
headline: Robin Hood foundation scores Wall Street support for nonprofits run by people of color
Watch Blue Origin launch and land its space tourism rocket New Shepard
summary: Jeff Bezos' space company Blue Origin is set to conduct the latest test flight of its rocket New Shepard on Tuesday.

headline: AMC could run out of cash by the end of 2020, company warns
summary: AMC, the largest cinema chain in the U.S., is in danger of running out of cash by the end of the year or by early 2021.
"We have a strong conviction that the average investor still is under-invested," BlackRock CEO Larry Fink told CNBC on Tuesday.
headline: CEO of world's biggest money manager sees 'more to go on the upside' for the stock market
Citigroup is set to report third-quarter earnings – here’s what the Street expects
summary: Citigroup, the third-biggest U.S. bank by assets, is in the midst of a major management change.
Kahoot said it plans to use the fresh funds to fuel growth through new partnerships, joint ventures and acquisitions.
headline: SoftBank invests $215 million in education start-up Kahoot as coronavirus boosts e-learning
Johnson & Johnson's coronavirus vaccine trial paused after 'adverse event' reported 36 hours ago
Watch these two transports stocks as Amazon, Target kick off online sales events, traders say
summary: Online sales events like those by Walmart, Amazon, Target and Best Buy "should be massively positive for both FedEx and UPS," trader Boris Schlossberg said.
JPMorgan, the biggest U.S. bank by assets, is also the first major lender to report earnings.
headline: JPMorgan Chase is set to report third-quarter earnings – here’s what the Street expects
